thread.title: Google acquires Jibe Mobile to help implement the RCS carrier messaging standard in Android
thread.title_full: Google acquires Jibe Mobile to help implement the RCS carrier messaging standard in Android

author: Emil Protalinski
title: Google acquires Jibe Mobile to help implement the RCS carrier messaging standard in Android
text:
Tags: Android , Google , Jibe , Jibe Mobile , RCS Image Credit: Shutterstock / 360b 
Google today announced it has acquired Jibe Mobile, a startup known as the “cloud communications company for mobile operators.” Details of the deal were not disclosed. 
In fact, the acquisition news was shoehorned in beside the news that Google was working to add Rich Communications Services (RCS), a new standard for carrier messaging, support in Android. Indeed, the company described Jibe as “a leading provider of RCS services.” 
Jibe will continue to help carriers deploy RCS to their users, but as part of Google. The two will work with the broader wireless industry (including mobile operators, device makers, and the rest of the Android ecosystem) to “create an even better messaging experience on Android.” 
Here is how Google explains why implement RCS is necessary: 
SMS carrier messaging is used by billions of people every day and enables people to reach anyone around the world, regardless of their device, carrier, app or location. However, the features available in SMS haven’t kept up with modern messaging apps. RCS is a new standard for carrier messaging and brings many of the features that people now expect from mobile messaging, such as group chats, high res photos and more. 
In other words, RCS will help texting become more like instant messaging. That’s already happening, but users need to have mobile data if they want more than simple SMS.
